00066 #define DEBUG_MDES 0
00067 
00068 static L_Alloc_Pool *SM_Mdes_pool = NULL;
00069 
00070 int
00071 SM_add_ids_to_entries (MD_Section * section)
00072 {
00073   MD_Entry *entry;
00074   MD_Field_Decl *id_field_decl;
00075   MD_Field *id_field;
00076   int id;
00077 
00078   /* Punt if there is already a field declared */
00079   if ((id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (section, "id")) != NULL)
00080     I_punt ("SM_add_ids_to_entries: Section '%s' already has id field!",
00081             section->name);
00082 
00083   /* Create required id field with one INT */
00084   id_field_decl = MD_new_field_decl (section, "id", MD_REQUIRED_FIELD);
00085   MD_require_int (id_field_decl, 0);
00086 
00087   /* Add ids to each field, starting with 0 */
00088   id = 0;
00089   for (entry = MD_first_entry (section); entry != NULL;
00090        entry = MD_next_entry (entry))
00091     {
00092       /* Create id field */
00093       id_field = MD_new_field (entry, id_field_decl, 1);
00094       MD_set_int (id_field, 0, id);
00095 
00096       id++;
00097     }
00098 
00099   /* Return the number of entries in this section */
00100   return (id);
00101 }
00102 
00103 void
00104 SM_build_resources (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
00105 {
00106   SM_Resource *resource, *resource_array;
00107   MD_Section *resource_section;
00108   MD_Entry *resource_entry;
00109   MD_Field_Decl *map_location_field_decl;
00110   MD_Field *map_location_field;
00111   int num_resources, size, index, id;
00112   int time_shift, max_offset;
00113 
00114   /* Get the resources section and the decl for map_location */
00115   resource_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Resource");
00116   map_location_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (resource_section,
00117                                                 "map_location");
00118 
00119   /* Add id's to each Resource entry (used to index array) 
00120    * and get the number of entries in the Resource section.
00121    */
00122   num_resources = SM_add_ids_to_entries (resource_section);
00123 
00124   /* Malloc an array of resources to hold info about each resource */
00125   size = num_resources * sizeof (SM_Resource);
00126   if ((resource_array = (SM_Resource *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00127     I_punt ("SM_build_resources: Out of memory");
00128 
00129   /* Copy contents of resource section into resource array,
00130    * array indexed by id of entry (numbered from 0 above)
00131    */
00132   id = 0;
00133   max_offset = -1;
00134   for (resource_entry = MD_first_entry (resource_section);
00135        resource_entry != NULL;
00136        resource_entry = MD_next_entry (resource_entry))
00137     {
00138       /* Get pointer to resource we are building */
00139       resource = &resource_array[id];
00140 
00141       /* Copy the resource's name */
00142       resource->name = strdup (resource_entry->name);
00143 
00144       /* Copy the map location information to resource array */
00145       map_location_field = MD_find_field (resource_entry,
00146                                           map_location_field_decl);
00147 
00148       /* Get the resource base offset into resource map */
00149       resource->offset = MD_get_int (map_location_field, 0);
00150 
00151       if (resource->offset > max_offset)
00152         max_offset = resource->offset;
00153 
00154       /* Place 1 at bit location specified by resource's index */
00155       index = MD_get_int (map_location_field, 1);
00156       resource->mask = (1 << index);
00157 
00158 #if DEBUG_MDES
00159       printf ("Resource %s: %i offset %x mask\n", resource->name,
00160               resource->offset, resource->mask);
00161 #endif
00162 
00163       /* Increment the id */
00164       id++;
00165     }
00166 
00167   /* Sanity check */
00168   if (id != num_resources)
00169     {
00170       I_punt ("SM_build_resources: id (%i) and # resources (%i) should agree",
00171               id, num_resources);
00172     }
00173 
00174   /* Calculate how many words/cycle is needed in the resource map
00175    * Always make a power of two so shifts can be used!
00176    * Store the amount to shift in sm_mdes->time_shift.
00177    */
00178   time_shift = 0;
00179   while ((max_offset + 1) > (1 << time_shift))
00180     time_shift++;
00181 
00182   sm_mdes->map_width = 1 << time_shift;
00183   sm_mdes->time_shift = time_shift;
00184 
00185 #if 0
00186   sm_mdes->time_shift += 0;
00187   printf ("Increasing time shift to %i\n", sm_mdes->time_shift);
00188 #endif
00189 
00190 
00191   /* Point sm_mdes at resource array */
00192   sm_mdes->resource = resource_array;
00193   sm_mdes->num_resources = num_resources;
00194 }
00195 
00196 void
00197 SM_build_units (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
00198 {
00199   SM_Resource *resource_array, *resource;
00200   SM_Option *unit_array, *unit;
00201   SM_Usage *usage_array, *usage;
00202   MD_Section *unit_section, *usage_section, *resource_section;
00203   MD_Entry *unit_entry, *ru_entry, *resource_entry;
00204   MD_Field_Decl *unit_use_field_decl, *resource_id_field_decl;
00205   MD_Field_Decl *ru_use_field_decl, *ru_time_field_decl;
00206   MD_Field *unit_use_field, *ru_use_field, *ru_time_field;
00207   MD_Field *resource_id_field;
00208   int num_units, array_size, num_usages;
00209   int index1, index2, id;
00210   int resources_used, map_offset, resource_offset;
00211   int usage_time, resource_id, time_shift;
00212 
00213   /* Get resource array for speed and ease of use */
00214   resource_array = sm_mdes->resource;
00215 
00216   /* Get the amount to shift the time of usage for ease of use */
00217   time_shift = sm_mdes->time_shift;
00218 
00219   /* Get the unit section and the use decl for use */
00220   unit_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Resource_Unit");
00221   unit_use_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (unit_section, "use");
00222 
00223   /* Get the usage section and decls for ease of use */
00224   usage_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Resource_Usage");
00225   ru_use_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (usage_section, "use");
00226   ru_time_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (usage_section, "time");
00227 
00228   /* Get the resource section and id decl for ease of use */
00229   resource_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Resource");
00230   resource_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (resource_section, "id");
00231 
00232   /* Add id's to each unit entry (used to index array) 
00233    * and get the number of entries in the Resource_Unit section.
00234    */
00235   num_units = SM_add_ids_to_entries (unit_section);
00236 
00237   /* Malloc an array of units to hold info about each resource unit */
00238   array_size = num_units * sizeof (SM_Option);
00239   if ((unit_array = (SM_Option *) malloc (array_size)) == NULL)
00240     I_punt ("SM_build_units: Out of memory");
00241 
00242   /* Use contents of the resource unit section (with Resource_Usage
00243    * and Resource links used) to the unit array.
00244    * Index array by id (numbered from 0 by SM_add_ids_to_entries)
00245    */
00246   id = 0;
00247   for (unit_entry = MD_first_entry (unit_section);
00248        unit_entry != NULL; unit_entry = MD_next_entry (unit_entry))
00249     {
00250       /* Get pointer to unit we are building */
00251       unit = &unit_array[id];
00252 
00253 #if DEBUG_MDES
00254       printf ("Building %s:\n", unit_entry->name);
00255 #endif
00256 
00257       /* Get the unit's use field */
00258       unit_use_field = MD_find_field (unit_entry, unit_use_field_decl);
00259 
00260       /* Create an array to hold all the usages in the use field */
00261       num_usages = unit_use_field->max_element_index + 1;
00262       array_size = num_usages * sizeof (SM_Usage);
00263       if ((usage_array = (SM_Usage *) malloc (array_size)) == NULL)
00264         I_punt ("SM_build_units: Out of memory");
00265 
00266       /* Build each usage in the array */
00267       for (index1 = 0; index1 < num_usages; index1++)
00268         {
00269           /* Get pointer to usage we are building */
00270           usage = &usage_array[index1];
00271 
00272           /* Get the ru_entry for this usage */
00273           ru_entry = MD_get_link (unit_use_field, index1);
00274 
00275           /* Get the time of this usage */
00276           ru_time_field = MD_find_field (ru_entry, ru_time_field_decl);
00277           usage_time = MD_get_int (ru_time_field, 0);
00278 
00279           /* Build the bit mask for the resource(s) used by this usage */
00280           resources_used = 0;
00281           resource_offset = -1;
00282           ru_use_field = MD_find_field (ru_entry, ru_use_field_decl);
00283           for (index2 = 0; index2 <= ru_use_field->max_element_index;
00284                index2++)
00285             {
00286               /* Get the resource entry at this index */
00287               resource_entry = MD_get_link (ru_use_field, index2);
00288 
00289               /* Get the id of this resource entry */
00290               resource_id_field = MD_find_field (resource_entry,
00291                                                  resource_id_field_decl);
00292               resource_id = MD_get_int (resource_id_field, 0);
00293 
00294               /* Get the resource from this id */
00295               resource = &resource_array[resource_id];
00296 
00297               /* Or in the bit for this resource */
00298               resources_used |= resource->mask;
00299 
00300               /* If this is the first resource added, get resource offset 
00301                * from it, otherwise check for consistency
00302                */
00303               if (index2 == 0)
00304                 resource_offset = resource->offset;
00305               else if (resource_offset != resource->offset)
00306                 {
00307                   I_punt ("SM_build_units: Offset mismatch (%i != %i)",
00308                           resource_offset, resource->offset);
00309                 }
00310             }
00311 
00312           /* Calculate the map offset, uses the width of the map 
00313            * (encoded into the map shift) and the offset of the usage.
00314            */
00315           map_offset = (usage_time << time_shift) + resource_offset;
00316 
00317           /* Save into to usage */
00318           usage->resources_used = resources_used;
00319           usage->map_offset = map_offset;
00320 
00321 #if DEBUG_MDES
00322           printf ("  %x at offset %i\n", resources_used, map_offset);
00323 #endif
00324         }
00325 
00326       /* Point unit at begining and end of usage */
00327       unit->first_usage = usage_array;
00328       unit->last_usage = &usage_array[num_usages - 1];
00329 
00330       /* Increment the id */
00331       id++;
00332     }
00333 
00334   /* Sanity check */
00335   if (id != num_units)
00336     I_punt ("SM_build_units: id (%i) and num_units (%i) should agree!",
00337             id, num_units);
00338 
00339 
00340   /* Point sm_mdes at unit array and set its size */
00341   sm_mdes->unit_array = unit_array;
00342   sm_mdes->unit_array_size = num_units;
00343 }
00344 
00345 void
00346 SM_build_choices (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
00347 {
00348   SM_Choice *choice_array, *choice;
00349   SM_Option *option_array, *option, *unit;
00350   MD_Section *option_section, *unit_section;
00351   MD_Entry *option_entry, *unit_entry;
00352   MD_Field_Decl *one_of_field_decl, *unit_id_field_decl;
00353   MD_Field *one_of_field, *unit_id_field;
00354   int num_choices, num_options, unit_id;
00355   int id, array_size, index1;
00356 
00357   /* Get the unit section and id field decl for ease of use */
00358   unit_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Resource_Unit");
00359   unit_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (unit_section, "id");
00360 
00361   /* Get the option section and one_of field decl for ease of use 
00362    * Used to build SM_Choice array.
00363    */
00364   option_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Table_Option");
00365   one_of_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (option_section, "one_of");
00366 
00367   /* Add id's to each Option entry (used to index array)
00368    * and get the number of entries in the Option section.
00369    */
00370   num_choices = SM_add_ids_to_entries (option_section);
00371 
00372   /* Malloc an array to hold choice info */
00373   array_size = num_choices * sizeof (SM_Choice);
00374   if ((choice_array = (SM_Choice *) malloc (array_size)) == NULL)
00375     I_punt ("SM_build_choices: Out of memory");
00376 
00377   /* Build choice array using option_section entry info */
00378   id = 0;
00379   for (option_entry = MD_first_entry (option_section); option_entry != NULL;
00380        option_entry = MD_next_entry (option_entry))
00381     {
00382       /* Get pointer to the choice we are building */
00383       choice = &choice_array[id];
00384 
00385 #if DEBUG_MDES
00386       printf ("Building choice %s:\n", option_entry->name);
00387 #endif
00388 
00389       /* Get the option's one_of field */
00390       one_of_field = MD_find_field (option_entry, one_of_field_decl);
00391 
00392       /* Create an array to hold all the units in the one_of field */
00393       num_options = one_of_field->max_element_index + 1;
00394       array_size = num_options * sizeof (SM_Option);
00395       if ((option_array = (SM_Option *) malloc (array_size)) == NULL)
00396         I_punt ("SM_build_choices: Out of memory");
00397 
00398       /* Build the options in the array */
00399       for (index1 = 0; index1 < num_options; index1++)
00400         {
00401           /* Get pointer to the option we are building */
00402           option = &option_array[index1];
00403 
00404           /* Get pointer to this option's unit */
00405           unit_entry = MD_get_link (one_of_field, index1);
00406           unit_id_field = MD_find_field (unit_entry, unit_id_field_decl);
00407           unit_id = MD_get_int (unit_id_field, 0);
00408           unit = &sm_mdes->unit_array[unit_id];
00409 
00410           /* Point the option at the unit's usages */
00411           option->first_usage = unit->first_usage;
00412           option->last_usage = unit->last_usage;
00413 #if DEBUG_MDES
00414           printf ("  Option %i: unit %s,  offset %i to %i\n",
00415                   index1,
00416                   unit_entry->name,
00417                   option->first_usage->map_offset,
00418                   option->last_usage->map_offset);
00419 #endif
00420         }
00421 
00422       /* Set the bounds of the option array in this choice */
00423       choice->first_option = option_array;
00424       choice->last_option = &option_array[num_options - 1];
00425 
00426       /* Update id */
00427       id++;
00428     }
00429 
00430   /* Sanity check */
00431   if (id != num_choices)
00432     I_punt ("SM_build_choices: id (%i) and num_choices (%i) should agree!",
00433             id, num_choices);
00434 
00435 
00436   /* Point sm_mdes at choice array and set its size */
00437   sm_mdes->choice_array = choice_array;
00438   sm_mdes->choice_array_size = num_choices;
00439 }
00440 
00441 void
00442 SM_build_tables (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
00443 {
00444   SM_Table *table_array, *table;
00445   SM_Choice *choice_array, *choice, *target_choice;
00446   MD_Section *table_section, *option_section, *unit_section;
00447   MD_Entry *table_entry, *option_entry, *unit_entry, *slot_specifier;
00448   MD_Field_Decl *one_of_field_decl, *option_id_field_decl;
00449   MD_Field_Decl *table_use_field_decl, *slot_specifier_field_decl;
00450   MD_Field_Decl *slot_field_decl, *max_time_field_decl;
00451   MD_Field *one_of_field, *option_id_field;
00452   MD_Field *table_use_field, *slot_specifier_field, *max_time_field;
00453   MD_Field *slot_field;
00454   unsigned short *slot_options;
00455   int num_tables, num_choices, num_options, option_id;
00456   int id, array_size, index1, slot_index;
00457   unsigned int max_usage_time, time_shift;
00458   int max_num_choices;
00459 
00460 
00461   /* Get the table section and use field decl for ease of use 
00462    * Used to build SM_Table array.
00463    */
00464   table_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Reservation_Table");
00465   table_use_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (table_section, "use");
00466   slot_specifier_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (table_section,
00467                                                   "slot_specifier");
00468   max_time_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (table_section, "max_usage_time");
00469 
00470   /* Get the option section and id and one_of field decl for ease of use */
00471   option_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Table_Option");
00472   option_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (option_section, "id");
00473   one_of_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (option_section, "one_of");
00474 
00475   /* Get the unit section and the slot field for ease of use */
00476   unit_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Resource_Unit");
00477   slot_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (unit_section, "slot");
00478 
00479   /* Get the time shift for max_usage_times's */
00480   time_shift = sm_mdes->time_shift;
00481 
00482   /* Add id's to each Reservation Table entry (used to index array)
00483    * and get the number of entries in the Reservation Table section.
00484    */
00485   num_tables = SM_add_ids_to_entries (table_section);
00486 
00487   /* Malloc an array to hold table info */
00488   array_size = num_tables * sizeof (SM_Table);
00489   if ((table_array = (SM_Table *) malloc (array_size)) == NULL)
00490     I_punt ("SM_build_tables: Out of memory");
00491 
00492   /* Calculate the max number of choices, so the schedule manager
00493    * can always create a choice array big enough for any table.
00494    */
00495   max_num_choices = 0;
00496 
00497   /* Build table array using table_section entry info */
00498   id = 0;
00499   for (table_entry = MD_first_entry (table_section); table_entry != NULL;
00500        table_entry = MD_next_entry (table_entry))
00501     {
00502       /* Get pointer to the table we are building */
00503       table = &table_array[id];
00504 
00505 #if DEBUG_MDES
00506       printf ("Building table %s:\n", table_entry->name);
00507 #endif
00508 
00509       /* Get the table's use field */
00510       table_use_field = MD_find_field (table_entry, table_use_field_decl);
00511 
00512       /* Get the slot specifier (option entry pointer) */
00513       slot_specifier_field = MD_find_field (table_entry,
00514                                             slot_specifier_field_decl);
00515       slot_specifier = MD_get_link (slot_specifier_field, 0);
00516 
00517       /* Create an array to hold all the choices in the use field */
00518       num_choices = table_use_field->max_element_index + 1;
00519       array_size = num_choices * sizeof (SM_Choice);
00520       if ((choice_array = (SM_Choice *) malloc (array_size)) == NULL)
00521         I_punt ("SM_build_tables: Out of memory");
00522 
00523       /* Update max_num_choices */
00524       if (num_choices > max_num_choices)
00525         max_num_choices = num_choices;
00526 
00527       /* Point each choice at the appropriate array.  Also identify
00528        * choice that specifies the slot
00529        */
00530       slot_index = -1;
00531       for (index1 = 0; index1 < num_choices; index1++)
00532         {
00533           /* Get pointer to the choice we are building */
00534           choice = &choice_array[index1];
00535 
00536           /* Get pointer to this choice's option entry */
00537           option_entry = MD_get_link (table_use_field, index1);
00538           option_id_field = MD_find_field (option_entry,
00539                                            option_id_field_decl);
00540           option_id = MD_get_int (option_id_field, 0);
00541           target_choice = &sm_mdes->choice_array[option_id];
00542 
00543           /* Point the option at the unit's usages */
00544           choice->first_option = target_choice->first_option;
00545           choice->last_option = target_choice->last_option;
00546 
00547 #if DEBUG_MDES
00548           printf ("  Choice %i: option %s id %i %x to %x (%i options)\n",
00549                   index1,
00550                   option_entry->name, option_id,
00551                   choice->first_option, choice->last_option,
00552                   (choice->last_option - choice->first_option) + 1);
00553 #endif
00554 
00555           /* Is this the choice that specifies the slot */
00556           if (option_entry == slot_specifier)
00557             {
00558               slot_index = index1;
00559 #if DEBUG_MDES
00560               printf ("    Slot specifier %s found.\n", slot_specifier->name);
00561 #endif
00562             }
00563 
00564         }
00565       table->first_choice = choice_array;
00566       table->last_choice = &choice_array[num_choices - 1];
00567       table->num_choices = num_choices;
00568 
00569       /* Make sure a slot was specified */
00570       if (slot_index == -1)
00571         {
00572           I_punt ("SM_build_tables: slot specifier %s not found in %s!\n",
00573                   slot_specifier->name, table_entry->name);
00574         }
00575       table->slot_choice = &choice_array[slot_index];
00576 
00577       /* Build the slot_options array (specifies slot used based on
00578        * the option chosen in slot_choice.
00579        */
00580       one_of_field = MD_find_field (slot_specifier, one_of_field_decl);
00581       num_options = one_of_field->max_element_index + 1;
00582       array_size = num_options * sizeof (unsigned short);
00583       if ((slot_options = (unsigned short *) malloc (array_size)) == NULL)
00584         I_punt ("SM_build_tables: Out of memory");
00585 
00586 #if DEBUG_MDES
00587       printf ("    Slot options:");
00588 #endif
00589       /* Get the slot from each option's unit entry */
00590       for (index1 = 0; index1 <= one_of_field->max_element_index; index1++)
00591         {
00592           unit_entry = MD_get_link (one_of_field, index1);
00593           slot_field = MD_find_field (unit_entry, slot_field_decl);
00594           slot_options[index1] = (unsigned short) MD_get_int (slot_field, 0);
00595 #if DEBUG_MDES
00596           printf (" %i", slot_options[index1]);
00597 #endif
00598         }
00599 #if DEBUG_MDES
00600       printf ("\n");
00601 #endif
00602 
00603       /* Point table at slot option array */
00604       table->slot_options = slot_options;
00605 
00606       /* Get the max_usage_time for this table */
00607       max_time_field = MD_find_field (table_entry, max_time_field_decl);
00608       max_usage_time = MD_get_int (max_time_field, 0);
00609 
00610       /* Calculate the max usage offset using the resource time_shift.
00611        * Want to get the offset for the last element at that time.
00612        * To do this, find the first element of time + 1, and subtract 1.
00613        * This turns 3 with time shift 1, into ((3 + 1) << 1) -1 = 7
00614        */
00615       table->max_usage_offset = ((max_usage_time + 1) << time_shift) - 1;
00616 
00617 #if DEBUG_OPTI
00618       printf (" %s max_usage_time = %i\n", table_entry->name,
00619               table->max_usage_time);
00620 #endif
00621 
00622       /* Update id */
00623       id++;
00624     }
00625 
00626   /* Sanity check */
00627   if (id != num_tables)
00628     I_punt ("SM_build_tables: id (%i) and num_tables (%i) should agree!",
00629             id, num_tables);
00630 
00631   /* Point sm_mdes at table array and set its size */
00632   sm_mdes->table_array = table_array;
00633   sm_mdes->table_array_size = num_tables;
00634 
00635   /* Write the maximumn number of choices across all tables to sm_mdes */
00636   sm_mdes->max_num_choices = max_num_choices;
00637 }
00638 
00639 /* 20030527 SZU
00640  * Function reads in the Syllable_Type section in mdes.
00641  * Assigns an index and power of 2 hex mask to each entry.
00642  * Entries with a compatible_with field are given the AND of all hex mask.
00643  * Record the top mask value in sm_mdes.
00644  */
00645 void
00646 SM_build_syllables (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
00647 {
00648   MD_Section *syll_section;
00649   MD_Field_Decl *num_slots_field_decl, *compatible_field_decl, *id_field_decl;
00650   MD_Entry *syll_entry;
00651   MD_Field *num_slots_field, *compatible_field;
00652   SM_Syllable *syllable, *syllable_array;
00653   int num_syllables, size, id, mask_offset, index;
00654   unsigned int top_syllable = 0;
00655 
00656   /* Get the Syllable_Types section and field_decl*/
00657   syll_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Syllable_Type");
00658   num_slots_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (syll_section, "num_slots");
00659   compatible_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (syll_section, "compatible_with");
00660 
00661   /* Add id's to each Syllable entry (used to index array)
00662    * and get the number of entries in the section.
00663    */
00664   num_syllables = SM_add_ids_to_entries (syll_section);
00665   id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (syll_section, "id");
00666 
00667   /* Malloc an array of syllables */
00668   size = num_syllables * sizeof (SM_Syllable);
00669   if ((syllable_array = (SM_Syllable *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00670     I_punt ("SM_build_syllables: Out of memory");
00671   
00672   /* Copy contents of section into array.
00673    * Index array by id (numbered from 0)
00674    */
00675   id = 0;
00676   mask_offset = 0;
00677   for (syll_entry = MD_first_entry (syll_section); syll_entry != NULL;
00678        syll_entry = MD_next_entry (syll_entry))
00679     {
00680       syllable = &syllable_array[id];
00681       syllable->name = strdup (syll_entry->name);
00682 
00683       num_slots_field = MD_find_field (syll_entry, num_slots_field_decl);
00684       syllable->num_slots = MD_get_int (num_slots_field, 0);
00685 
00686       /* If compatible_with section exists for this entry,
00687        * AND the compatible_with field entries for the mask.
00688        */
00689       if ((compatible_field =
00690            MD_find_field (syll_entry, compatible_field_decl)) != NULL)
00691         {
00692           syllable->mask = 0;
00693           
00694           for (index = 0; index <= compatible_field->max_element_index; index++)
00695             {
00696               MD_Entry *target_entry;
00697               MD_Field *target_field;
00698               int input_id;
00699               SM_Syllable *compatible_syll;
00700               
00701               target_entry = MD_get_link (compatible_field, index);
00702               target_field = MD_find_field (target_entry, id_field_decl);
00703               input_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
00704 
00705               /* Get the syll from this id */
00706               compatible_syll = &syllable_array[input_id];
00707 
00708               /* OR in the bit for this syll */
00709               syllable->mask |= compatible_syll->mask;
00710             }
00711         }
00712       /* Otherwise base the mask on the id */
00713       else
00714         {
00715           syllable->mask = (1 << mask_offset);
00716           /* Keep track of the top hex syllable value.
00717            * Don't need to worry about compatible_with results.
00718            */
00719           top_syllable = syllable->mask;
00720           mask_offset++;
00721         }
00722 
00723 #if DEBUG_MDES
00724       printf ("Syllable %s: num_slots %i mask 0x%x\n", syllable->name, 
00725               syllable->num_slots, syllable->mask);
00726 #endif
00727       id++;
00728     }
00729 
00730   /* Point sm_mdes at syllable array */
00731   sm_mdes->syllable_array = syllable_array;
00732   sm_mdes->num_syllables = num_syllables;
00733   sm_mdes->top_syllable = top_syllable;
00734 }
00735 
00736 /* 20030527 SZU
00737  * Function reads in the Port_Type section in mdes.
00738  * Assigns an index and power of 2 hex mask to each entry.
00739  * Make sure order of entry is kept in the array;
00740  * becomes the scheduling priority order.
00741  */
00742 void
00743 SM_build_ports (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
00744 {
00745   MD_Section *port_section, *syll_section;
00746   MD_Field_Decl *syll_field_decl, *syll_id_field_decl;
00747   MD_Entry *port_entry, *syll_entry;
00748   MD_Field *syll_field, *syll_id_field;
00749   SM_Syllable *syll_array;
00750   SM_Port *port, *port_array;
00751   int num_ports, size, id, syll_id;
00752 
00753   /* Get the syllable array */
00754   syll_array = sm_mdes->syllable_array;
00755 
00756   /* Get the Port section and field_decl*/
00757   port_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Port_Type");
00758   syll_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (port_section, "syll");
00759 
00760   syll_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Syllable_Type");
00761   syll_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (syll_section, "id");
00762 
00763   num_ports = SM_add_ids_to_entries (port_section);
00764 
00765   /* Malloc an array of ports */
00766   size = num_ports * sizeof (SM_Port);
00767   if ((port_array = (SM_Port *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00768     I_punt ("SM_build_ports: Out of memory");
00769   
00770   /* Copy contents of section into array.
00771    * Index array by id (numbered from 0)
00772    */
00773   id = 0;
00774   for (port_entry = MD_first_entry (port_section); port_entry != NULL;
00775        port_entry = MD_next_entry (port_entry))
00776     {
00777       port = &port_array[id];
00778       port->name = strdup (port_entry->name);
00779 
00780       port->mask = (1 << id);
00781 
00782       /* Get the corresponding syllable */
00783       syll_field = MD_find_field (port_entry, syll_field_decl);
00784       syll_entry = MD_get_link (syll_field, 0);
00785 
00786       /* Get id */
00787       syll_id_field = MD_find_field (syll_entry, syll_id_field_decl);
00788       syll_id = MD_get_int (syll_id_field, 0);
00789 
00790       port->syllable = &syll_array[syll_id];
00791 
00792 #if DEBUG_MDES
00793       printf ("Port %s: mask 0x%x syllable %s mask 0x%x\n", port->name,
00794               port->mask, port->syllable->name, port->syllable->mask);
00795 #endif
00796       id++;
00797     }
00798 
00799   /* Point sm_mdes at port array */
00800   sm_mdes->port_array = port_array;
00801   sm_mdes->num_ports = num_ports;
00802 }
00803 
00804 /* 20030528 SZU
00805  * Reads in Restrictions section.
00806  * Create resource restrictions based on Port_Types.
00807  */
00808 void
00809 SM_build_restrictions (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
00810 {
00811   MD_Section *restrict_section, *port_section;
00812   MD_Field_Decl *num_field_decl, *ports_field_decl,*id_field_decl;
00813   MD_Entry *restrict_entry, *port_entry;
00814   MD_Field *num_field, *ports_field, *port_id_field;
00815   SM_Restriction *restrict, *restrict_array;
00816   SM_Port *port_array, *compatible_port;
00817   int num_restricts, size, id, index, port_id;
00818 
00819   /* Get the port array */
00820   port_array = sm_mdes->port_array;
00821 
00822   /* Get the Restrictions section and field_decl*/
00823   restrict_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Restrictions");
00824   num_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (restrict_section, "num");
00825   ports_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (restrict_section, "ports");
00826 
00827   port_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Port_Type");
00828   id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (port_section, "id");
00829 
00830   num_restricts = SM_add_ids_to_entries (restrict_section);
00831 
00832   /* Malloc an array of ports */
00833   size = num_restricts * sizeof (SM_Restriction);
00834   if ((restrict_array = (SM_Restriction *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00835     I_punt ("SM_build_restrictions: Out of memory");
00836   
00837   /* Copy contents of section into array.
00838    * Index array by id (numbered from 0)
00839    */
00840   id = 0;
00841   for (restrict_entry = MD_first_entry (restrict_section);
00842        restrict_entry != NULL; restrict_entry = MD_next_entry (restrict_entry))
00843     {
00844       restrict = &restrict_array[id];
00845       restrict->name = strdup (restrict_entry->name);
00846       restrict->mask = 0;
00847 
00848       num_field = MD_find_field (restrict_entry, num_field_decl);
00849 
00850       restrict->num = MD_get_int (num_field, 0);
00851 
00852       /* Get the corresponding ports and their masks
00853        * OR together all the port masks to create mask for restriction
00854        */
00855       ports_field = MD_find_field (restrict_entry, ports_field_decl);
00856 
00857       for (index = 0; index <= ports_field->max_element_index; index++)
00858         {
00859           port_entry = MD_get_link (ports_field, index);
00860           port_id_field = MD_find_field (port_entry, id_field_decl);
00861           port_id = MD_get_int (port_id_field, 0);
00862 
00863           /* Get the port from this id */
00864           compatible_port = &port_array[port_id];
00865 
00866           /* OR in the bit for this syll */
00867           restrict->mask |= compatible_port->mask;
00868         }
00869 
00870 #if DEBUG_MDES
00871       printf ("Restriction %s: num %i mask 0x%x\n", restrict->name,
00872               restrict->num, restrict->mask);
00873 #endif
00874       id++;
00875     }
00876   /* Point sm_mdes at restrict array */
00877   sm_mdes->restrict_array = restrict_array;
00878   sm_mdes->num_restricts = num_restricts;
00879 }
00880 
00881 /* 20030529 SZU
00882  * Read in the Template_Type section.
00883  */
00884 void
00885 SM_build_templates (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
00886 {
00887   MD_Section *template_section, *syll_section;
00888   MD_Field_Decl *syll_field_decl, *stop_field_decl, *syll_id_field_decl;
00889   MD_Field *syll_field, *stop_field;
00890   MD_Entry *template_entry;
00891   SM_Template *template, *template_array;
00892   int num_templates, size, shift_var, slots_per_template, index, id;
00893   int current_template_slots;
00894   unsigned int tmp_shift;
00895 
00896   /* Get the Template_Type section and field_decl*/
00897   template_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Type");
00898   syll_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (template_section, "syll");
00899   stop_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (template_section, "stop");
00900 
00901   /* Get the Syllable_Type section and id_field_decl */
00902   syll_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Syllable_Type");
00903   syll_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (syll_section, "id");
00904 
00905   num_templates = SM_add_ids_to_entries (template_section);
00906 
00907   /* Malloc an array of templates */
00908   size = num_templates * sizeof (SM_Template);
00909   if ((template_array = (SM_Template *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00910     I_punt ("SM_build_templates: Out of memory");
00911 
00912   /* Get the highest syll type to figure out the shift_var.
00913    * shift_var set as multiple of 4 for clarity's sake.
00914    * Not required, and can be changed.
00915    */
00916   shift_var = 0;
00917   tmp_shift = sm_mdes->top_syllable;
00918   while (tmp_shift)
00919     {
00920       tmp_shift = tmp_shift >> 4;
00921       shift_var += 4;
00922     }
00923 
00924   slots_per_template = 0;
00925   id = 0;
00926   for (template_entry = MD_first_entry (template_section);
00927        template_entry != NULL; template_entry = MD_next_entry (template_entry))
00928     {
00929       template = &template_array[id];
00930       template->name = strdup (template_entry->name);
00931       template->mask = 0;
00932 
00933       /* Get the entries under syll field.
00934        * Make sure number of slots per template all equal.
00935        * Shift and OR together the syllables.
00936        */
00937       current_template_slots = 0;
00938       syll_field = MD_find_field (template_entry, syll_field_decl);
00939 
00940       for (index = 0; index <= syll_field->max_element_index; index++)
00941         {
00942           MD_Entry *syll_entry;
00943           MD_Field *syll_id_field;
00944           int syll_id;
00945           SM_Syllable *syllable;
00946 
00947           syll_entry = MD_get_link (syll_field, index);
00948           syll_id_field = MD_find_field (syll_entry, syll_id_field_decl);
00949           syll_id = MD_get_int (syll_id_field, 0);
00950 
00951           /* Get the syllable from this id */
00952           syllable = &sm_mdes->syllable_array[syll_id];
00953 
00954           /* Increment the current templates slots */
00955           current_template_slots += syllable->num_slots;
00956 
00957           /* OR in bits for this syll after shifting */
00958           template->mask = template->mask << shift_var;
00959           template->mask |= syllable->mask;
00960 
00961           /* Account for syllables that take more than one slot */
00962           if (syllable->num_slots > 1)
00963             template->mask =
00964               template->mask << shift_var * (syllable->num_slots - 1);
00965         }
00966 
00967       /* current_template_slots better equal slots_per_template */
00968       if (slots_per_template == 0)
00969         slots_per_template = current_template_slots;
00970       else if (current_template_slots != slots_per_template)
00971         I_punt ("SM_build_templates: Template %s have different # of slots!",
00972                 template->name);
00973 
00974       /* Allocate space for stop bits and initialize to 0 */
00975       size = slots_per_template * sizeof (int);
00976       if ((template->stop_bits = (int *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
00977         I_punt ("SM_build_templates: Out of memory");
00978       for (index = 0; index < slots_per_template; index++)
00979         template->stop_bits[index] = 0;
00980 
00981       /* Go through the stop field and record the information */
00982       stop_field = MD_find_field (template_entry, stop_field_decl);
00983       for (index = 0; index <= stop_field->max_element_index; index++)
00984         {
00985           int stop_id;
00986 
00987           stop_id = MD_get_int (stop_field, index);
00988 
00989           /* Sanity check */
00990           if ((stop_id < 0) || (stop_id >= slots_per_template))
00991             I_punt ("SM_build_templates: stop bits out of range");
00992 
00993           /* Set the appropriate spot in the stop_bit array */
00994           template->stop_bits[stop_id] = 1;
00995         }
00996 
00997       /* Derive bit mask for template_mask. Used by Issue_Group */
00998       template->template_mask = 1 << id;
00999 
01000 #if DEBUG_MDES
01001       printf ("Template %s: mask 0x%x template_mask 0x%x\n", template->name,
01002               template->mask, template->template_mask);
01003       for (index = 0; index < slots_per_template; index++)
01004         {
01005           printf ("stop%i %i\n", index, template->stop_bits[index]);
01006         }
01007 #endif
01008 
01009       id++;
01010     }
01011 
01012 #if 0
01013   /* Sanity check.
01014    * Total number of slots is a multiple of slots_per_template.
01015    * 20030529 SZU
01016    * Do this check in lmdes2, when num_slots is available.
01017    */
01018   if (sm_mdes->md_mdes->num_slots % slots_per_template != 0)
01019     I_punt ("SM_build_templates: Total number of slots not divisible by "
01020             "slots per template!");
01021 #endif
01022   
01023   /* Point sm_mdes fields */
01024   sm_mdes->template_array = template_array;
01025   sm_mdes->num_templates = num_templates;
01026   sm_mdes->template_shift_var = shift_var;
01027   sm_mdes->slots_per_template = slots_per_template;
01028 }
01029 
01030 /* 20030529 SZU
01031  * Read in Template_Group section
01032  */
01033 void
01034 SM_build_tgroups (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
01035 {
01036   MD_Section *tgroup_section, *template_section;
01037   MD_Field_Decl *one_of_field_decl, *one_of_id_field_decl;
01038   MD_Field *one_of_field, *one_of_id_field;
01039   MD_Entry *tgroup_entry, *one_of_entry;
01040   SM_TGroup *tgroup, *tgroup_array;
01041   SM_Template *template;
01042   int num_tgroups, id, index, size, one_of_id;
01043 
01044   /* Get the Template_Type section and field_decl*/
01045   tgroup_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Group");
01046   one_of_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (tgroup_section, "one_of");
01047 
01048   template_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Type");
01049   one_of_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (template_section, "id");
01050 
01051   num_tgroups = SM_add_ids_to_entries (tgroup_section);
01052 
01053   /* Malloc an array of tgroups */
01054   size = num_tgroups * sizeof (SM_TGroup);
01055   if ((tgroup_array = (SM_TGroup *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
01056     I_punt ("SM_build_tgroups: Out of memory");
01057   
01058   /* Copy contents of section into array.
01059    * Index array by id (numbered from 0)
01060    */
01061   id = 0;
01062   for (tgroup_entry = MD_first_entry (tgroup_section);
01063        tgroup_entry != NULL; tgroup_entry = MD_next_entry (tgroup_entry))
01064     {
01065       tgroup = &tgroup_array[id];
01066       tgroup->name = strdup (tgroup_entry->name);
01067       tgroup->mask = 0;
01068 
01069       /* Get the corresponding templates and their masks
01070        * OR together all the templates masks to create mask for tgroup
01071        */
01072       one_of_field = MD_find_field (tgroup_entry, one_of_field_decl);
01073 
01074       for (index = 0; index <= one_of_field->max_element_index; index++)
01075         {
01076           one_of_entry = MD_get_link (one_of_field, index);
01077           one_of_id_field = MD_find_field (one_of_entry, one_of_id_field_decl);
01078           one_of_id = MD_get_int (one_of_id_field, 0);
01079 
01080           /* Get the template from this id */
01081           template = &sm_mdes->template_array[one_of_id];
01082 
01083           /* OR in the template mask for this template */
01084           tgroup->mask |= template->template_mask;
01085         }
01086 
01087 #if DEBUG_MDES
01088       printf ("TGroup %s: mask 0x%x\n", tgroup->name, tgroup->mask);
01089 #endif
01090       id++;
01091     }
01092 
01093   /* Point sm_mdes fields */
01094   sm_mdes->tgroup_array = tgroup_array;
01095   sm_mdes->num_tgroups = num_tgroups;
01096 }
01097 
01098 /* 20030530 SZU
01099  * Read in Issue_Group section
01100  */
01101 void
01102 SM_build_issues (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
01103 {
01104   MD_Section *issue_section, *template_section, *tgroup_section;
01105   MD_Field_Decl *templates_field_decl, *template_id_field_decl;
01106   MD_Field_Decl *tgroup_id_field_decl;
01107   MD_Field *templates_field;
01108   MD_Entry *issue_entry;
01109   SM_Issue *issue, *issue_array;
01110   int num_issues, size, index, id, max_template_per_issue;
01111 
01112   /* Get the Issue_Group section and field_decl*/
01113   issue_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Issue_Group");
01114   templates_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (issue_section, "templates");
01115 
01116   template_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Type");
01117   template_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (template_section, "id");
01118   tgroup_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Group");
01119   tgroup_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (tgroup_section, "id");
01120 
01121   num_issues = SM_add_ids_to_entries (issue_section);
01122 
01123   /* Malloc an array of ports */
01124   size = num_issues * sizeof (SM_Issue);
01125   if ((issue_array = (SM_Issue *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
01126     I_punt ("SM_build_issues: Out of memory");
01127   
01128   /* Copy contents of section into array.
01129    * Index array by id (numbered from 0)
01130    */
01131   id = 0;
01132   max_template_per_issue = 0;
01133   for (issue_entry = MD_first_entry (issue_section); issue_entry != NULL;
01134        issue_entry = MD_next_entry (issue_entry))
01135     {
01136       issue = &issue_array[id];
01137       issue->name = strdup (issue_entry->name);
01138 
01139       /* Get the template field */
01140       templates_field = MD_find_field (issue_entry, templates_field_decl);
01141       issue->num_templates = templates_field->max_element_index + 1;
01142 
01143       if (issue->num_templates > max_template_per_issue)
01144         max_template_per_issue = issue->num_templates;
01145           
01146       /* Malloc an array of unsigned ints */
01147       size = issue->num_templates * sizeof (unsigned int);
01148       if ((issue->templates = (unsigned int *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
01149         I_punt ("SM_build_issues: Out of memory");
01150   
01151       for (index = 0; index <= templates_field->max_element_index; index++)
01152         {
01153           MD_Entry *target_entry;
01154           MD_Field *target_field;
01155           int target_id;
01156           SM_Template *template;
01157           SM_TGroup *tgroup;
01158 
01159           /* Get the target entry */
01160           target_entry = MD_get_link (templates_field, index);
01161 
01162           /* See if target is Template_Type, otherwise Template_Group */
01163           if (strcmp (target_entry->section->name, "Template_Type") == 0)
01164             {
01165               target_field =
01166                 MD_find_field (target_entry, template_id_field_decl);
01167               target_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
01168 
01169               /* Get the template */
01170               template = &sm_mdes->template_array[target_id];
01171 
01172               issue->templates[index] = template->template_mask;
01173             }
01174           else
01175             {
01176               target_field = MD_find_field (target_entry, tgroup_id_field_decl);
01177               target_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
01178 
01179               /* Get the tgroup */
01180               tgroup = &sm_mdes->tgroup_array[target_id];
01181 
01182               issue->templates[index] = tgroup->mask;
01183             }
01184         }
01185 #if DEBUG_MDES
01186       printf ("Issue %s: num_templates %i\n", issue->name,
01187               issue->num_templates);
01188       for (index = 0; index < issue->num_templates; index++)
01189         {
01190           printf ("template%i 0x%x\n", index, issue->templates[index]);
01191         }
01192 #endif
01193       id++;
01194     }
01195 
01196   /* Point sm_mdes fields */
01197   sm_mdes->issue_array = issue_array;
01198   sm_mdes->num_issues = num_issues;
01199   sm_mdes->max_template_per_issue = max_template_per_issue;
01200 }
01201 
01202 /* 20030531 SZU
01203  * Read in Dispersal_Rule section
01204  * 20030617 SZU
01205  * Take care of new OPTIONAL template field.
01206  */
01207 void
01208 SM_build_drules (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
01209 {
01210   MD_Section *drule_section, *port_section, *syll_section, *rsrc_section;
01211   MD_Section *template_section, *tgroup_section;
01212   MD_Field_Decl *slot_field_decl, *port_field_decl, *syll_field_decl;
01213   MD_Field_Decl *rsrc_field_decl, *port_id_field_decl, *syll_id_field_decl;
01214   MD_Field_Decl *rsrc_id_field_decl, *subrsrc_field_decl, *temp_field_decl;
01215   MD_Field_Decl *template_id_field_decl, *tgroup_id_field_decl;
01216   MD_Field *slot_field, *port_field, *syll_field, *rsrc_field, *subrsrc_field;
01217   MD_Field *temp_field;
01218   MD_Entry *drule_entry;
01219   SM_DRule *drule, *drule_array;
01220   int num_drules, size, index, id;
01221   unsigned int subrsrc_mask = 0;
01222 
01223   /* Get the Dispersal_Rule section and field_decl*/
01224   drule_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Dispersal_Rule");
01225   slot_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (drule_section, "slot");
01226   port_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (drule_section, "port_type");
01227   syll_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (drule_section, "syll_type");
01228   rsrc_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (drule_section, "resource");
01229   subrsrc_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (drule_section, "subresource");
01230 
01231   port_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Port_Type");
01232   port_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (port_section, "id");
01233   syll_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Syllable_Type");
01234   syll_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (syll_section, "id");
01235   rsrc_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Resource");
01236   rsrc_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (rsrc_section, "id");
01237 
01238   /* 20030617 SZU */
01239   temp_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (drule_section, "template");
01240   template_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Type");
01241   template_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (template_section, "id");
01242   tgroup_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Group");
01243   tgroup_id_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl (tgroup_section, "id");
01244 
01245   num_drules = SM_add_ids_to_entries (drule_section);
01246 
01247   /* Malloc an array of ports */
01248   size = num_drules * sizeof (SM_DRule);
01249   if ((drule_array = (SM_DRule *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
01250     I_punt ("SM_build_drules: Out of memory");
01251   
01252   /* Copy contents of section into array.
01253    * Index array by id (numbered from 0)
01254    */
01255   id = 0;
01256   for (drule_entry = MD_first_entry (drule_section); drule_entry != NULL;
01257        drule_entry = MD_next_entry (drule_entry))
01258     {
01259       MD_Entry *target_entry;
01260       MD_Field *target_field;
01261       int target_id;
01262       SM_Port *port;
01263       SM_Syllable *syll;
01264       SM_Resource *rsrc;
01265 
01266       drule = &drule_array[id];
01267       drule->name = strdup (drule_entry->name);
01268       subrsrc_mask = 0;
01269 
01270       /* Get the slot field.
01271        * If no slot field, then applies to all slots.
01272        * Assign 0 to drule->num_slots
01273        */
01274       if ((slot_field = MD_find_field (drule_entry, slot_field_decl)) != NULL)
01275         {
01276           drule->num_slots = slot_field->max_element_index + 1;
01277 
01278           /* Malloc an array of ints for slots */
01279           size = drule->num_slots * sizeof (int);
01280           if ((drule->slot = (int *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
01281             I_punt ("SM_build_drules: Out of memory");
01282       
01283           for (index = 0; index <= slot_field->max_element_index; index++)
01284             {
01285               /* Get the slot integer and save it */
01286               target_id = MD_get_int (slot_field, index);
01287               drule->slot[index] = target_id;
01288             }
01289         }
01290       else
01291         {
01292           drule->num_slots = 0;
01293         }
01294 
01295       /* Get the port field and the mask */
01296       port_field = MD_find_field (drule_entry, port_field_decl);
01297       target_entry = MD_get_link (port_field, 0);
01298       target_field = MD_find_field (target_entry, port_id_field_decl);
01299       target_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
01300       port = &sm_mdes->port_array[target_id];
01301       drule->port_mask = port->mask;
01302 
01303       /* Get the syll field and the mask */
01304       syll_field = MD_find_field (drule_entry, syll_field_decl);
01305       target_entry = MD_get_link (syll_field, 0);
01306       target_field = MD_find_field (target_entry, syll_id_field_decl);
01307       target_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
01308       syll = &sm_mdes->syllable_array[target_id];
01309       drule->syll_mask = syll->mask;
01310 
01311       drule->templates = 0;
01312       /* Get the template masks if any */
01313       if ((temp_field = MD_find_field (drule_entry, temp_field_decl)) != NULL)
01314         {
01315           for (index = 0; index <= temp_field->max_element_index; index++)
01316             {
01317               MD_Entry *target_entry;
01318               MD_Field *target_field;
01319               int target_id;
01320               SM_Template *template;
01321               SM_TGroup *tgroup;
01322 
01323               /* Get the target entry */
01324               target_entry = MD_get_link (temp_field, index);
01325 
01326               /* See if target is Template_Type, otherwise Template_Group */
01327               if (strcmp (target_entry->section->name, "Template_Type") == 0)
01328                 {
01329                   target_field =
01330                     MD_find_field (target_entry, template_id_field_decl);
01331                   target_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
01332 
01333                   /* Get the template */
01334                   template = &sm_mdes->template_array[target_id];
01335 
01336                   drule->templates |= template->template_mask;
01337                 }
01338               else
01339                 {
01340                   target_field =
01341                     MD_find_field (target_entry, tgroup_id_field_decl);
01342                   target_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
01343 
01344                   /* Get the tgroup */
01345                   tgroup = &sm_mdes->tgroup_array[target_id];
01346 
01347                   drule->templates |= tgroup->mask;
01348                 }
01349             }
01350         }
01351 
01352       /* Go through the subrsrc fields and OR all resources if any */
01353       if ((subrsrc_field = MD_find_field (drule_entry, subrsrc_field_decl)) !=
01354           NULL)
01355         {
01356           for (index = 0; index <= subrsrc_field->max_element_index; index++)
01357             {
01358               /* Get the resource mask */
01359               target_entry = MD_get_link (subrsrc_field, index);
01360               target_field =
01361                 MD_find_field (target_entry, rsrc_id_field_decl);
01362               target_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
01363 
01364               rsrc = &sm_mdes->resource[target_id];
01365               subrsrc_mask |= rsrc->mask;
01366             }
01367         }
01368 
01369       /* Get the resource field */
01370       rsrc_field = MD_find_field (drule_entry, rsrc_field_decl);
01371       drule->num_rsrcs = rsrc_field->max_element_index + 1;
01372 
01373       /* Malloc an array of unsigned ints for resources */
01374       size = drule->num_rsrcs * sizeof (unsigned int);
01375       if ((drule->rsrc = (unsigned int *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
01376         I_punt ("SM_build_drules: Out of memory");
01377   
01378       for (index = 0; index <= rsrc_field->max_element_index; index++)
01379         {
01380           /* Get the resource mask */
01381           target_entry = MD_get_link (rsrc_field, index);
01382           target_field = MD_find_field (target_entry, rsrc_id_field_decl);
01383           target_id = MD_get_int (target_field, 0);
01384 
01385           rsrc = &sm_mdes->resource[target_id];
01386           drule->rsrc[index] = rsrc->mask;
01387 
01388           /* Add subrsrc mask */
01389           drule->rsrc[index] |= subrsrc_mask;
01390         }
01391 #if DEBUG_MDES
01392       printf ("Dispersal Rule %s:\n", drule->name);
01393       for (index = 0; index < drule->num_slots; index++)
01394         printf ("slot %i ", drule->slot[index]);
01395       printf ("\nPort 0x%x Syllable 0x%x\n", drule->port_mask,
01396               drule->syll_mask);
01397       for (index = 0; index < drule->num_rsrcs; index++)
01398         printf ("resource 0x%x ", drule->rsrc[index]);
01399       printf ("\ntemplates 0x%x\n", drule->templates);
01400 #endif
01401       id++;
01402     }
01403 
01404   /* Point sm_mdes fields */
01405   sm_mdes->drule_array = drule_array;
01406   sm_mdes->num_drules = num_drules;
01407 }
01408 
01409 /* 20020805 SZU
01410  * Modified to read in p_lat_class(c_lat_class) instead of prod(cons),
01411  * because prod(cons) altered by customizer and don't match latency class.
01412  * 20020822 SZU
01413  * Updated due to lat_class changing from string to hash int.
01414  */
01415 void
01416 SM_build_prod_cons_latency (SM_Mdes * sm_mdes)
01417 {
01418   SM_PCLat *pclat_array, *pclat;
01419   MD_Section *pclat_section;
01420   MD_Field_Decl *plat_field_decl, *pdest_field_decl, *clat_field_decl;
01421   MD_Field_Decl *csrc_field_decl, *latency_field_decl;
01422   MD_Field *plat_field, *pdest_field, *clat_field, *csrc_field, *latency_field;
01423   MD_Entry *pclat_entry;
01424   int num_pclat, array_size, id, num_prod, num_cons;
01425   int current_plat, current_clat, index;
01426   int latency, penalize;
01427   int *pdest_array, *pdest, *csrc_array, *csrc, op;
01428   Set plat, clat;
01429   int src_operands, dest_operands;
01430   MD *md;
01431 
01432   /* Get the Prod_Cons_Latency section and use field decl for ease of use. */
01433   pclat_section = MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Prod_Cons_Latency");
01434   plat_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl(pclat_section, "p_lat_class");
01435   pdest_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl(pclat_section, "pdest");
01436   clat_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl(pclat_section, "c_lat_class");
01437   csrc_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl(pclat_section, "csrc");
01438   latency_field_decl = MD_find_field_decl(pclat_section, "latency");
01439 
01440   /* Add id's to each Prod_Cons_Lat entry.
01441    * Get number of entries.
01442    */
01443   num_pclat = SM_add_ids_to_entries (pclat_section);
01444 
01445   /* Malloc an array to hold the pclat info */
01446   array_size = num_pclat * sizeof (SM_PCLat);
01447   if ((pclat_array = (SM_PCLat *) malloc (array_size)) == NULL)
01448     I_punt ("SM_build_prod_cons_latency: Out of memory");
01449 
01450   /* Build array using pclat_section entry info */
01451   id = 0;
01452   for (pclat_entry = MD_first_entry (pclat_section); pclat_entry != NULL;
01453        pclat_entry = MD_next_entry (pclat_entry))
01454     {
01455       /* Get pointer inside pclat_array */
01456       pclat = &pclat_array[id];
01457 
01458       /* Copy the PCLat name */
01459       pclat->name = strdup (pclat_entry->name);
01460 
01461       /* Get the latency field and latency value */
01462       latency_field = MD_find_field (pclat_entry, latency_field_decl);
01463       latency = MD_get_int (latency_field, 0);
01464 
01465       /* Get the pclat's p_lat_class field */
01466       plat_field = MD_find_field (pclat_entry, plat_field_decl);
01467 
01468       /* 20020822 SZU */
01469       /* Create a Set to hold the plat info */
01470       num_prod = plat_field->max_element_index + 1;
01471       plat = Set_new();
01472 
01473       /* Go through each producer and add to the Set */
01474       for (current_plat = 0; current_plat < num_prod; current_plat++)
01475         {
01476           /* Get the hash int of this producer */
01477           op = MD_get_int (plat_field, current_plat);
01478 
01479           Set_add (plat, op);
01480         }
01481 
01482 #if 0
01483       pclat->plat = plat;
01484 #else
01485       pclat->plat = Set_copy (plat);
01486       Set_dispose (plat);
01487 #endif
01488 
01489       /* Get the pdest field */
01490       pdest_field = MD_find_field (pclat_entry, pdest_field_decl);
01491 
01492       /* 20020911 SZU
01493        * Change from hard code 4 dest to get number from Mdes
01494        */
01495       md = sm_mdes->md_mdes;
01496       dest_operands = get_int_parm (md, "num_dest_operands");
01497 
01498       /* Malloc array to hold pdest info */
01499       if((pdest_array = (int *) malloc (sizeof(int) * dest_operands)) == NULL)
01500             I_punt ("SM_build_prod_cons_latency: Out of memory");
01501       for (index = 0; index < 4; index++)
01502         {
01503           /* Get pointer */
01504           pdest = &pdest_array[index];
01505 
01506           /* Get current index value; 1 or 0 */
01507           penalize = MD_get_int (pdest_field, index);
01508 
01509           /* If penalize = 1, add penalty for this operand */
01510           *pdest = penalize * latency;
01511         }
01512 
01513       pclat->pdest_latency_penalty = pdest_array;
01514 
01515       /* Get the clat field */
01516       clat_field = MD_find_field (pclat_entry, clat_field_decl);
01517 
01518       num_cons = clat_field->max_element_index + 1;
01519       clat = Set_new();
01520 
01521       /* Go through each consumer and add to the Set */
01522       for (current_clat = 0; current_clat < num_cons; current_clat++)
01523         {
01524           /* Get the hash int of this consumer */
01525           op = MD_get_int (clat_field, current_clat);
01526 
01527           Set_add (clat, op);
01528         }
01529 
01530 #if 0
01531       pclat->clat = clat;
01532 #else
01533       pclat->clat = Set_copy (clat);
01534       Set_dispose (clat);
01535 #endif
01536 
01537       /* Get the csrc field */
01538       csrc_field = MD_find_field (pclat_entry, csrc_field_decl);
01539 
01540       /* 20020911 SZU
01541        * Change from hard code 6 src to get number from Mdes
01542        */
01543       src_operands = get_int_parm (md, "num_src_operands");
01544 
01545       /* Malloc array to hold csrc info */
01546       if((csrc_array = (int *) malloc (sizeof(int) * src_operands)) == NULL)
01547             I_punt ("SM_build_prod_cons_latency: Out of memory");
01548       for (index = 0; index < 6; index++)
01549         {
01550           /* Get pointer */
01551           csrc = &csrc_array[index];
01552 
01553           /* Get current index value; 1 or 0 */
01554           penalize = MD_get_int (csrc_field, index);
01555 
01556           /* If penalize = 1, add penalty for this operand */
01557           /* 20020808 SZU
01558            * Due to the way SM takes the latency info, 
01559            * csrc is now only a bit vector, not multiplied w/ latency.
01560            */
01561           *csrc = penalize;
01562         }
01563 
01564       pclat->csrc_latency_penalty = csrc_array;
01565 
01566       /* Increment the id */
01567       id++;
01568     }
01569 
01570   /* Point sm_mdes at table array and set its size */
01571   sm_mdes->pclat_array = pclat_array;
01572   sm_mdes->pclat_array_size = num_pclat;
01573 }
01574 
01575 /* Print out the information stored in sm_mdes->pclat_array
01576  * for debugging purposes.
01577  * 20020823 SZU
01578  * Modified due to data structure change to Set.
01579  */
01580 void
01581 Print_prod_cons_latency (SM_Mdes *sm_mdes)
01582 {
01583   SM_PCLat *pclat_array, *pclat;
01584   int index1, index2, latency;
01585 
01586   pclat_array = sm_mdes->pclat_array;
01587 
01588   for (index1 = 0; index1 < sm_mdes->pclat_array_size; index1++)
01589     {
01590       /* Get a pointer to current pclat */
01591       pclat = &pclat_array[index1];
01592 
01593       /* Print the PCLat's name */
01594       printf ("PCLat: %s\n", pclat->name);
01595 
01596       //printf ("Producers:\n");
01597       Set_print (stdout, "Producers:", pclat->plat);
01598 
01599       /* Print the pdest latency */
01600       for (index2 = 0; index2 < 4; index2++)
01601         {
01602           latency = pclat->pdest_latency_penalty[index2];
01603           printf ("%i", latency);
01604         }
01605       printf ("\n");
01606 
01607       //printf ("Consumers:\n");
01608       Set_print (stdout, "Consumers:", pclat->clat);
01609 
01610       /* Print the csrc latency */
01611       for (index2 = 0; index2 < 6; index2++)
01612       {
01613         latency = pclat->csrc_latency_penalty[index2];
01614         printf ("%i", latency);
01615       }
01616       printf ("\n");
01617       printf("\n");
01618     }
01619 }
01620 
01621 SM_Mdes *
01622 SM_build_mdes (Mdes2 * mdes2)
01623 {
01624   SM_Mdes *sm_mdes;
01625 
01626   /* Create alloc pool if necessary */
01627   if (SM_Mdes_pool == NULL)
01628     SM_Mdes_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("SM_Mdes", sizeof (SM_Mdes), 1);
01629 
01630   /* Alloc sm_mdes data structure */
01631   sm_mdes = (SM_Mdes *) L_alloc (SM_Mdes_pool);
01632 
01633   /* Point at the mdes2 this sm_mdes is being built from */
01634   sm_mdes->mdes2 = mdes2;
01635   sm_mdes->md_mdes = mdes2->md_mdes;
01636 
01637   /* Build the resource array, set num_resources, map_width, 
01638    * and time_shift.
01639    */
01640   SM_build_resources (sm_mdes);
01641 
01642   /* Build the unit array and set num_units */
01643   SM_build_units (sm_mdes);
01644 
01645   /* Build the choice array and set num_choices */
01646   SM_build_choices (sm_mdes);
01647 
01648   /* Build the table array and set num_tables */
01649   SM_build_tables (sm_mdes);
01650 
01651   /* 20030527 SZU
01652    * Functions necessary to read in new Itanium descriptions in mdes.
01653    * Replaced hard coded version.
01654    */
01655   if (MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Syllable_Type") != NULL)
01656     {
01657       SM_build_syllables (sm_mdes);
01658     }
01659   else
01660     {
01661       sm_mdes->syllable_array = NULL;
01662       sm_mdes->num_syllables = 0;
01663       sm_mdes->top_syllable = 0;
01664     }
01665 
01666   if (MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Port_Type") != NULL)
01667     {
01668       SM_build_ports (sm_mdes);
01669     }
01670   else
01671     {
01672       sm_mdes->port_array = NULL;
01673       sm_mdes->num_ports = 0;
01674     }
01675 
01676   if (MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Restrictions") != NULL)
01677     {
01678       SM_build_restrictions (sm_mdes);
01679     }
01680   else
01681     {
01682       sm_mdes->restrict_array = NULL;
01683       sm_mdes->num_restricts = 0;
01684     }
01685 
01686   if (MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Type") != NULL)
01687     {
01688       SM_build_templates (sm_mdes);
01689     }
01690   else
01691     {
01692       sm_mdes->template_array = NULL;
01693       sm_mdes->num_templates = 0;
01694       sm_mdes->template_shift_var = 0;
01695       sm_mdes->slots_per_template = 0;
01696     }
01697 
01698   if (MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Template_Group") != NULL)
01699     {
01700       SM_build_tgroups (sm_mdes);
01701     }
01702   else
01703     {
01704       sm_mdes->tgroup_array = NULL;
01705       sm_mdes->num_tgroups = 0;
01706     }
01707 
01708   if (MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Issue_Group") != NULL)
01709     {
01710       SM_build_issues (sm_mdes);
01711     }
01712   else
01713     {
01714       sm_mdes->issue_array = NULL;
01715       sm_mdes->num_issues = 0;
01716       sm_mdes->max_template_per_issue = 0;
01717     }
01718 
01719   if (MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Dispersal_Rule") != NULL)
01720     {
01721       SM_build_drules (sm_mdes);
01722     }
01723   else
01724     {
01725       sm_mdes->drule_array = NULL;
01726       sm_mdes->num_drules = 0;
01727     }
01728 
01729   /* 20020723 SZU
01730    * Build the prod_cons_latency array
01731    * Prod_Cons_Latency section not in all mdes. Check first.
01732    */
01733   if (MD_find_section (sm_mdes->md_mdes, "Prod_Cons_Latency") != NULL)
01734     {
01735       SM_build_prod_cons_latency (sm_mdes);
01736 
01737 #if DEBUG_MDES
01738       /* Function to print out prod_cons_latency for debugging */
01739       Print_prod_cons_latency (sm_mdes);
01740 #endif
01741     }
01742   else
01743     {
01744       /* Prod_Cons_Latency section not in mdes. Set to 0. */
01745 #if 0
01746       printf("No Prod_Cons_Latency in mdes\n");
01747 #endif
01748       sm_mdes->pclat_array = NULL;
01749       sm_mdes->pclat_array_size = 0;
01750     }
01751 
01752   /* Return the newly created sm_mdes data structure */
01753   return (sm_mdes);
01754 }
